dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2018, the ICO proposed fines totalling £140,000 on organizations tied to Aaron Banks and Leave.EU.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty eighteen, the I C O proposed fines totalling one hundred forty thousand pounds on organizations tied to Aaron Banks and the website.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That resulted in proposed fines on organizations run by Brexit's biggest single donor, Aaron Banks, and Leave.EU totalling £135,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that's just the tip of the iceberg. They also handed information about Facebook's tracking practices to Ireland's Data Protection Commission.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that's just the tip of the iceberg. They also handed information about Facebook's tracking practices to Ireland's Data Protection Commission.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And so it's handed the information it obtained during the investigation to Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, specifically around targeting functions and monitoring browsing habits across devices. And fake ads are part of that referral too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, specifically around targeting functions and monitoring browsing habits across devices. And fake ads are part of that referral too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are in the process of referring other outstanding issues about Facebooks targeting functions and techniques used to monitor individuals' browsing habits, interactions and behaviour across the internet and different devices to the Irish Data Protection Commission, as the lead supervisory authority for Facebook under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The ICO spokesperson told Forbes fake ads would be included in that referral.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, given the recent reports—like The Intercept finding they could target ads to people interested in 'white genocide.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, given the recent reports-like The Intercept finding they could target ads to people interested in 'white genocide.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Intercept found last week it could advertise to those interested in white genocide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's just… horrifying. And it came right after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just... horrifying. And it came right after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The report came just days after a man believed to have held such views shot 11 dead at a Pittsburgh synagogue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then Vice got ads approved that pretended to be from Senators—just by falsifying who was behind them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then Vice got ads approved that pretended to be from Senators-just by falsifying who was behind them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice was able to set up ads purportedly backed by Senators. The reporter had to do little more than lie about who he worked for and who he was, and Facebook approved the ads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So much for transparency. Facebook admitted those never should've gone through.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So much for transparency. Facebook admitted those never should've gone through.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook admitted they never should have been approved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Business Insider even got ads approved under Cambridge Analytica's name, which is wild given their history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Business Insider even got ads approved under Cambridge Analytica's name, which is wild given their history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And Business Insider reported Facebook approved its ads that claimed to have been paid for by Cambridge Analytica, the data analytics company that was at the center of a furore around access to personal information belonging to users of the social media website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like the 'Paid for by' feature is almost useless if it's this easy to manipulate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like the 'Paid for by' feature is almost useless if it's this easy to manipulate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Facebook says they comply with EU data laws, but these examples suggest there's a real enforcement gap.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Facebook says they comply with E U data laws, but these examples suggest there's a real enforcement gap.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Facebook spokesperson said: We regularly engage with regulators regarding our advertising tools, which we believe fully comply with EU data protection laws.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now it's up to Ireland's DPC to decide if punishment is needed, but they haven't even received the referral yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now it's up to Ireland's D P C to decide if punishment is needed, but they haven't even received the referral yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Irish regulator has not yet received the referral, however. As and when it's forthcoming, the body will explore Facebook's practises and and whether any punishment is required.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so we're still waiting to see what steps they take. Facebook says they're engaging with regulators, but…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so we're still waiting to see what steps they take. Facebook says they're engaging with regulators, but...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Facebook spokesperson said: We regularly engage with regulators regarding our advertising tools, which we believe fully comply with EU data protection laws.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But after a month of embarrassing reports, it's hard to take that at face value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But after a month of embarrassing reports, it's hard to take that at face value.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. This feels like a systemic issue, not just a few slip-ups.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. This feels like a systemic issue, not just a few slip-ups.
